title: A week with Mr. Unger
content:
It's been great hearing from [Gerard Unger](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021153737/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Gerard%20Unger) this week. At lunch he told a joke i found quite humorous:

Q: what do making love in a canoe and american coffee have in common?  
A: they're both too close to water.

For a few more insights, you can check out [my other blog](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021153737/http:/www.pilcrowtype.com/blog) (still very much a work in progress).
author: paul d hunt

comments.content: I've heard this joke several times in another version. Instead of "American coffee", substitute in "American beer." And instead of "too," bring in…well, I don't think Typophile's censoring system will display it if I type it in here ;-)
Long ago when I was a student in London, you had to go to an Italian restaurant to get decent coffee. Now you can go to Starbucks :)
